script: This is Berk, the best kept secret this side of, well...
Granted, it may not look like much, but this wet heap of rock packs more than a few surprises.
Life here is amazing, just not for the faint of heart.
You see, where most folks enjoy hobbies like whittling or needlepoint, we Berkians prefer...
...a little something we like to call...
I'm sorry, Fishlegs, did you want that?
Did I tell you that you look amazing today?
It's starting to stink around here.
Fishlegs and Snotlout trail with none!
Scared him off with the big talk, didn't you, Stoick?
She's my princess-- whatever she wants, she gets.
Ruffnut? Didn't she try to bury you alive?
HICCUP: Now, dragons used to be a bit of a problem here, but that was five years ago.
We have custom stables, all-you-can-eat feeding stations, a full-service dragon wash...
even top-of-the-line fire prevention, if I do say so myself.
We can still win this thing!
Up! Up, up, up, up, up!
You guys are fighting for Ruffnut?
Whoo! No one can stop me now!
HICCUP: Yep, Berk is pretty much perfect.
All of my hard work has paid off.
And it's a good thing, too, because with Vikings on the backs of dragons...
...the world just got a whole lot bigger.
So, what do you think, bud?
You want to give this another shot?
That really came out of nowhere.
We-we got to work on your solo gliding there, bud.
That, uh, locked-up tail makes for some pretty sloppy rescue maneuvers, hey?
Looks like we found another one, bud.
Oh, what, do you want an apology?
Is that why you're pouting, big baby boo?
Oh, you feeling it yet? Huh?
Picking up on all my heartfelt remorse?
Ah. Yeah. Oh, come on, come on, you-you wouldn't hurt Uh...
locked in combat to the bitter...
You know that doesn't wash out.
So, what should we name it?
Think we might find a few Timberjacks in those woods?
The odd Whispering Death or two in the rocks?
Who knows, maybe we'll finally track down another Night Fury.
The real question is, where have you been?
I wake up, the sun's shining, Terrible Terrors are singing on the rooftop, I saunter down to breakfast thinking all is right with the world, and I get: Son, we need to talk.
I got a whole day of goofing off to get started.
Okay, first of all, I-I don't sound like that.
what is that thing you're doing with my shoulders?
Yeah, that's-that's a really flattering impersonation.
You're the pride of Berk, son, and I couldn't be prouder.
I'm pretty impressed with myself, too.
You're all grown up, and since no chief could ask for a better successor, I've decided...
Y-You're gonna wear out the spring coil.
Yeah, so... this is what I'm dealing with.
By the time he turned around, I was gone.
Well... it's a lot of responsibility.
The map will have to wait, for sure, and... and I'll need to fly Toothless, since you'll be too busy, but...
All those speeches and planning and running the village, that's his thing.
I think you're missing the point.
You... know exactly who you are, you always have, but...
I know that I'm not my father, and I never met my mother, so...
What you're searching for isn't out there, Hiccup...
Maybe you just don't see it yet.
Is that what I think it is?
Thought they were all gone for good.
Looks like our luck's had a turn for the better, lads!
Don't think Drago has one of those...
Look, we don't want any trouble.
Hah! You should have thought of that before you stole all of our dragons and blasted our fort to bits!
Hah! Dragon trapping is hard enough work as it is without do-gooder dragon riders sneaking in to rescue them.
You mean other than your thieving friend from last night? You tell me.
You may have an ice-spitting dragon on your side, but we still have a quota to fill.
How do you suppose we explain this mess to Drago Bludvist?
Does anything you say make sense?
He's expecting a new shipment of dragons for his army by tomorrow.
And Drago don't take well to excuses!
This is what he gave me last time I showed up empty-handed.
He promised to be far less understanding in the future.
All right, look, we don't know anything about a dragon thief or an ice-spitting dragon or your lunatic boss and his dragon army, okay?
Just give us back our dragon, and we'll go...
strange, hostile person whom we've never met.
it's not just anyone who can capture a Night Fury.
You will never hold on to those dragons!
Drago is coming for them all!
Eh! He's probably flown off the edge of the world by now.
You sure you want that kid running the village?
You can still delay your retirement.
Who finally decided to show up for work. Yay.
Hey, uh, Dad, could I have a word?
Something you're itching to tell me?
Uh, not quite the itch you're thinking of, but, yes.
Now, lesson one: a chief's first duty is to his people, so... 41!
Well, can we just talk in private for...
MAN 2: Hey, I was ahead of you!
Okay, okay, I want one of those high seaters with lots of spikes and a big storage compartment!
Dad, this is actually a little more important than building saddles.
Ah, lesson two: no task is too small when it comes to serving your people.
You let the forge die down again!
Dad... Yeah, but seriously, Go on. Have away.
I really need to tell you about this new land we came across.
We didn't stick around to find out.
Your Night Fury and Deadly Nadder didn't bring them cheering to the rooftops?
Not the standard run-for-the-hills hoo-ha I've come to enjoy.
You should have seen their fort.
All blown apart and stuck in giant spikes of ice.
I've never seen anything like it.
A-And worst of all, they thought we did it!
You know, you two are gonna get yourselves in serious trouble one of these days.
Not everyone appreciates this way of life.
Best we keep to our own.
Besides, you'll have more important uses for your time.
Once we make the big announcement!
They are building a dragon army.
Or-or at least the guy they work for is. Uh...
I'll bloody his fist with my face if he tries to take my dragon!
STOICK: No dragon or Viking sets foot off this island until I give the word!
Wait, because some guy you knew is stirring up trouble in some faraway land?
Because Drago Bludvist is a madman without conscience or mercy.
And if he's built a dragon army, gods help us all.
Then let's ride back out there.
We'll follow those trappers to Drago and talk some sense into him.
It's our duty to keep the peace.
I must prepare you for war.
Dad, if Drago's coming for our dragons, we can't wait around for him to get here.
Let's go find him and change his mind.
No, some minds won't be changed, Hiccup.
Berk is what you need to worry about.
ERET: Keep your eyes peeled, lads!
With this wind, we'll reach Drago by daybreak.
So best we fill this ship up with dragons, and quick!
It's no time to be picky!
Not if we want to keep our...
ERET: You're not getting away this time.
ERET: And here I was, worried we might turn up empty-handed.
That's one Night Fury, uh, one Deadly Nadder, and...
two of the finest dragon riders west of Luk Tuk.
That ought to make the boss happy, right?
HICCUP: Uh, the dragons don't really care for cramped spaces, so they'll just hang out with you.
You know, wooden boats, big ocean...
Just what every dragon trapper needs.
One end coats the blade in Monstrous Nightmare saliva.
The other sprays Hideous Zippleback gas.
All it takes is a spark, and...
HICCUP: Oh, yeah, there you go.
HICCUP: Once they see you as one of their own, even the testiest dragons can be trained.
ERET: What game are you playing?
Because I'm going to change his mind about dragons.
Once you've earned his loyalty, there is nothing a dragon won't do for you.
I can change yours, right here, right now.
See how well I protect and provide?
TUFFNUT: What is with all the nets?
RUFFNUT: Hey, watch it! That was...
Um, what are you guys doing here?
I don't need to be rescued.
Well, didn't you just pick the wrong ship, eh?
I'm trying to protect our dragons and stop a war.
Because war is what he wants, son!
Years ago, there was a great gathering of chieftains to discuss the dragon scourge we all faced.
Into our midst came a stranger from a strange land, covered in scars and draped in a cloak of dragon skin.
He carried no weapon and spoke softly, saying that he, Drago Bludvist, was a man of the people, devoted to freeing mankind from the tyranny of dragons.
He claimed that he alone could control the dragons, and that he alone could keep us safe, if we chose to bow down and follow him.
until he wrapped himself in his cloak and cried out, Then see how well you do without me!
DRAGO: ...see how well you do without me!
The rooftop suddenly burst into flames, and from it, armored dragons descended, burning the hall to the ground.
was the only one to escape.
Men who kill without reason cannot be reasoned with.
This is what I'm good at, and-and if I could change your mind, I can change his, too.
Lead the others back to Berk.
I've had enough mutiny for one day.
I'm not gonna let anything happen to you.
You left my dragon back there!
He can't fly on his own!
We have to head back Who are you?
Do you even understand what I'm saying?
Oh, it's okay, it's okay, it's okay.
I'm glad to see you, too, bud.
You really had me worried there.
Aye, she could never stay put, either.
GOBBER: Eh, he's just 20, and a Viking.
I mean, could there be a worse combination?
Heh! When I think of how stubborn and senseless you were back in the day.
Well, not much has changed, actually.
Ah, you know what he's like.
And if Hiccup finds Drago before we find him...
Nothing can hurt Hiccup, so long as that Night Fury's around.
You can't just say something like that and run off.
Do you... Do you grasp how insane it sounds?
But they-they said you were dead!
Everyone thinks you were eaten by...
This is where you've been for 20 years?
It's a bit much to get my head around, to be frank.
It's not every day you find out your mother is some kind of crazy, feral, vigilante dragon lady.
at least I'm not boring, right?
Well, I suppose there is that...
He might very well be the last of his kind.
Oh... and look, he's your age.
No wonder you get along so well.
I found him in the woods.
He was shot down and wounded.
This Snafflefang lost his leg to one of Drago Bludvist's iron traps.
This Raincutter had her wing sliced by razor netting.
And this, oh, poor Hobblegrunt was blinded by a tree snare and then left to die alone and scared.
Did Drago or his trappers do this, too?
I'm actually the one who shot him down.
You couldn't save all of me, could you?
You just had to make it even.
what did your father think of your Night Fury friend?
Oh, he-he didn't take it all that well.
Pretty soon, everyone back home had dragons of their own.
Believe me, I tried, as well, but people are not capable of change, Hiccup.
MOTHER: Berk was a land of kill or be killed, but I believed peace was possible.
MOTHER: It was a very unpopular opinion.
MOTHER: Then one night, a dragon broke into our house, finding you in the cradle.
But what I saw was proof of everything I believed.
This wasn't a vicious beast, but an intelligent, gentle creature, whose soul reflected my own.
VALKA: You and your father nearly died that night.
All because I couldn't kill a dragon.
It broke my heart to stay away, but I believed you'd be safer if I did.
Oh, Cloudjumper never meant to harm me.
He must have thought I belonged here in the home of the great Bewilderbeast.
One of the very few that still exist.
Every nest has its queen, but this is the king of all dragons.
With his icy breath, this graceful giant built our nest, a safe haven for dragons everywhere.
He's responsible for all that destruction?
We all live under his care and his command.
VALKA: All but the babies, of course...
I've lived among them for 20 years, Hiccup, discovering their secrets.
They should've been back with Hiccup by now.
Eret, son of Eret, was the man of my dreams.
But, baby, I grew facial hair for you.
What if Drago shot them down?
What if they need our help?
It doesn't matter what he said if they've all been captured.
ERET: We've nowhere to go, nothing to sell, and no heads to call our own.
If we don't turn up with dragons and fast...
Yay, can he ride with me?
You're gonna show us the way to Drago.
And help dragon riders sneak into Drago's camp?
Okay! I'll take you to Drago!
Hey, I-I thought we were going to eat.
And then, from Dragon Island, I found this archipelago...
VALKA: Oh, when I'm up here, I don't even feel the cold.
This is what it is to be a dragon, Hiccup.
It's all well and good to call yourself a dragon, but can you fly?
We just about had it that time.
All this time, you took after me.
Will you give me another chance?
I-I can teach you all that I've learned these past 20 years.
Now you can make those tight turns.
Every dragon has its secrets. And...
I'll show them all to you.
We'll unlock every mystery, find every last species-- together, as mother and son.
This gift we share, Hiccup, it bonds us.
This is who you are, son.
We will change the world for all dragons.
We will make it a better, safer place.
Yeah, I mean, that sounds amazing.
Now you and I can go talk to Drago together.
Now get this thing off me.
Never take a toy from a dragon.
Why does this keep happening to me?
Large diameter bubbles, massive lungs, cold water deep dweller, I'm thinking class five leviathan, maybe six.
Always great to see you, my friend.
Well, as you can see, I am right on time with a new batch of dragons, just like I promised.
ERET: And as an added bonus, I also caught you their riders.
Turns out there's a whole bunch of them out there.
Drago doesn't have them after all.
hunting them down as we speak.
They won't know where you're hiding.
They know we're missing, and they have tracking dragons.
If you so much as touch us, Hiccup is gonna kick...
He's only the son of Stoick the Vast, his heir to the throne of Berk, and the greatest dragon master this world has ever seen.
And unless you let us go right now, he will blast through here on his Night Fury and blow your entire fleet of ships to splinters.
Then they'll be crying like babies.
First there was one rider, and now all of Berk?
And you led them to me!
We must attack the dragon riders' nest at once!
We will take down their alpha.
we can't wait around for Drago to attack this place.
We've got to find him first.
The same way we're getting you out.
Okay, uh, Dad, there-there's something you need to know.
Well, this isn't an on the way kind of update, actually.
More-more of the earth-shattering development variety.
Yeah, just add it to pile.
HICCUP: Yeah, I, uh, uh, Dad, unlike most surprises I spring on you, this is one you'll like, I promise.
You just have to handle it delicately.
you might want to take this one.
Oh, uh, Dad, could you put the sword away, please?
I know what you're gonna say, Stoick.
How could I have done this?
Stayed away all of these years, and why didn't I come back to you?
what sign did I have that you could change, Stoick?
I pleaded so many times to stop the fighting, to find another answer, but did any of you listen?
This is why I never married.
I know that I left you to raise Hiccup alone, but I thought he'd be better off without me, and I was wrong.
Go on, shout, scream, say something!
You're as beautiful as the day I lost you.
SNOTLOUT: Could this day get any worse?
We're gonna jump into freezing cold water and then die from drowning.
You are a steaming heap of dragon...
So, are we going to save your dragons and get out of here or not?
I don't know, you just keep doing what you're doing.
Thank you for saving my life.
Now let me return the favor.
Mom, you'd never even recognize it.
Where we used to make weapons, we now build saddles, wing slings...
You-you wouldn't believe how much everything's changed.
Aye, your son's changed Berk for the better.
I think we did well with this one, Val.
Well, you know, I didn't marry you for your cooking.
Her meatballs could kill more beasts than a battle ax.
I've still got a few knocking And once you move back in with all your dragons, old Drago won't even stand a chance.
It's a lot to take in.
I thought I'd have to die before we'd have that dance again.
Will you be my wife once again?
Thank Odin you didn't listen to me, son.
Val, it's all right, it's all right.
Now, what do you want to do?
We have to save the dragons.
Whatever comes, keep hitting the mountain.
DRAGO: We need to draw the alpha out.
You really are full of surprises.
Oh, you know, catching up with Mom.
Well, now you know where I get my dramatic flair.
Show them what you got, bud.
I've waited a long time for this.
They are controlled by the alpha!
Then it's a good thing I brought a challenger.
FISHLEGS: That is a class ten! Class ten!
Val, do you think you can stop them?
It takes more than a little fire to kill me!
The son of Stoick the Vast?
Dragons, they-they are kind, amazing creatures that can bring people together.
You see, I know what it is to live in fear, to see my village burned, my family taken.
left with nothing, I vowed to rise above the fear of dragons...
...and liberate the people of this world.
Well, you need dragons to conquer other dragons.
Or maybe you need dragons to conquer people...
to control those who follow you...
and to get rid of those who won't.
The world wants peace, and we have the answer back on Berk.
Just... let me show you-- No!
No dragon can resist the alpha's command.
So he who controls the alpha...
T-Toothless, you okay, bud? What's going on?
The strength of will over others.
DRAGO: In the face of it, you are nothing.
Uh... what did he just tell you?
No, no, no, no, come on, what are you doing?
HICCUP: No! Get away from him!
Go on! Get out of here!
VALKA: Good dragons under the control of bad people...
Gather the men and meet me at Berk!
GOBBER: May the Valkyries welcome you and lead you through Odin's great battlefield.
May they sing your name with love and fury, so that we might hear it rise from the depths of Valhalla, and know that you've taken your rightful place at the table of kings.
For a great man has fallen.
And I'm not the peacekeeper I thought I was.
You came early into this world.
You were such a wee thing.
I feared you wouldn't make it.
He always said you'd become the strongest of them all.
You have the heart of a chief, and the soul of a dragon.
Only you can bring our worlds together.
That... is who you are, son.
I was so afraid of becoming my dad.
Mostly because I thought I never could.
that great, that... brave, that... selfless?
I guess you can only try.
FISHLEGS: I don't want to die!
But won't that Bewilderbeast just take control of these guys, too?
Some might suggest this is poorly conceived!
Well, it's a good thing that I never listen.
Get Toothless back and kick Drago's...
No one can protect you now!
Try to keep his focus off of Toothless.
Have you forgotten who you're riding with?
There isn't a dragon alive that I can't wrangle! Aah!
You certainly are hard to get rid of, I'll say that.
But, please, O Great Dragon Master, try... to take him.
He will not miss a second time.
We need to get those two apart.
We gotta block him out, Toothless.
Now let's try this one more time!
No, no, no, no, no! No!
This is what it is to earn a dragon's loyalty.
You never cease to amaze me, bud.
Toothless, you know that doesn't wash out!
Oh, give me a cuddle, Grumpy!
Don't you ever leave again, Hookfang.
Oh, you are. Yes, you are.
ERET: That was some pretty fine dragon- wrangling back there.
You know... Skullcrusher is gonna need somebody to look after him now.
Oh, your father, he'd be every bit as proud as I am.
I'm really glad you're here, Mom.
I told you it was in here.
A bit trampled and busted and covered in ice, but it's home.
Those who attacked us are relentless and crazy.
We may be small in numbers, but we stand for something bigger than anything the world can pit against us.
We are the voice of peace.
And bit by bit, we will change this world.
You see, we have something they don't.
Oh, sure, they have armies, and they have armadas, but we...
